titleStmt.title: John A. Peebles et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7330

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To his Excellency Thomas E Bramlette
Governor of the State of Kentucky --

The undersigned citizens of Adair County represent that W. S Turpin was by a Judgments of the Adair Circuit Court rendered at the MayNov term ^1865^ fined one hundred & sixty Dollars in the cases of selling spirits to slaves and one for selling to a Soldier making the aggregate aforesaid. We regard the cases proper for Executive clemency and pray the remittance thereof except fees & costs & as in duty bound we will ever pray --

Nov 21st 1865
Case Nos 1, 2 & 7 are for selling spirits to a slave & No 8 is for selling spirits to soldiers &c

Jno. A. Peebles
W E Baker
Eugene Triplett
Ethan Smith
J W Suddarth
D. Griffith
Alexander Harvey
Jo. Coffey
Wm E Russell
J Burton
Wm H Walker
Timoleon Cravens
Burton Bryant

James Vigas
Thoms D Riggle
P. C. Hardin
A H Judd
I. C Winfrey
James. R Ewing
C R Page

Horace K Buckner
William H Roach
J J. D. Royse
Wm O. Murrel
W. H. Hudson
Thos. T. Willson

John W Bennett
Peter Bryant

James H Bernard
W. DeB Owens

W. K. Long

Adair Cir Ct
vs
Wm S Turpin
3 judgts for $50. each. Selling Liquor to Slaves & one for $10. to Soldiers
